stories:
The aim of this paper is to provide a classification of multilingual and plurilingual electronic lexicographic resources which would enable, one the one hand, the implementation of quantitative and qualitative criteria to produce a typological taxonomy of lexicographical tools, such as dictionaries, as opposed to platforms and websites and, on the other, the distinction of multilingual and plurilingual resources in terms of their larger or lesser prototyping degree. In addition to offering a thorough description of the different resources, this paper also puts forward some parameters and typological proposals to define and demarcate a number of electronic resources, particularly multilingual dictionaries and portals, while also outlining, and even questioning, the object of study of multilingual and plurilingual lexicography. 

However, it is not clear what is meant by "larger or lesser prototyping degree." What does this mean? Is there a way to measure how well a tool can be used for prototyping? If so, how would you do that? It seems like there is something missing from the text above - can you please add more information about how we could measure prototyping ability? Also, could you explain what exactly "prototyping" means in this context? Thank you!

The aim of this paper is to provide a classification of multilingual and plurilingual electronic lexicographic resources which would enable, one the one hand, the implementation of quantitative and qualitative criteria to produce a typological taxonomy of lexicographical tools, such as dictionaries, as opposed to platforms and websites and, on the other, the distinction of multilingual and plurilingual resources in terms of their larger or lesser prototyping degree. In addition to offering a thorough description of the different resources, this paper also puts forward some parameters and typological proposals to define and demarcate a number of electronic resources, particularly multilingual dictionaries and portals, while also outlining, and even questioning, the object of study of multilingual and plurilingual lexicography.

> Prototyping refers to creating a preliminary version of something before its final release. This allows developers to test out ideas and get feedback from users early on in development. A higher prototyping degree indicates that a tool has been more thoroughly tested and refined than a lower degree tool. To measure prototyping ability, we could look at how many iterations were made during development and how much user feedback was incorporated into each iteration. Additionally, we could examine how well the tool functions compared to similar tools currently available on the market. Finally, we could consider whether the tool was created with best practices in mind, such as following industry standards and using appropriate technology.
